segments.title: Definition of Density
segments.summary: Explains density as the ratio of mass to volume, measured in kg/m³. Describes density as a measure of how packed or crowded something is in a given volume.

segments.title: Examples of Material Densities
segments.summary: Compares densities of different materials - water at 1 g/cm³ and iron at 7.8 g/cm³. Explains that water's density of 1 g/cm³ was used to define the gram unit.

segments.title: Air Density Variation
segments.summary: Discusses how air density varies with altitude, from 0.1 g/cm³ at surface to 0.004 g/cm³ at airline cruising altitude. Explains why density decreases with height due to less air pressure above.

segments.title: Water Density Temperature Relationship
segments.summary: Explains how water's density changes with temperature, reaching maximum density at 4°C at 1 g/cm³. This unique property affects how water bodies behave in cold conditions.

segments.title: Density and Floating
segments.summary: Explains how objects with lower density float while those with higher density sink. Uses examples of oil floating on water and iron sinking in water.
